cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles NNE of Tiburon, Haiti (moving through the Gulf of Gonave)
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest, then northwest across the Bahamas and toward the southeast Florida coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest approach just offshore the southeast Florida coastline near Port Everglades/Ft. Lauderdale

weather_observation.watch_coast: Seven Mile Bridge (Florida Keys) northward to south of Deerfield Beach, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: No Florida warnings yet (warnings confined to Haiti, Cuba and the Bahamas)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast, Bahamas, and eventually the coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely by early Thursday; hurricane-force winds possible late Thursday if Matthew tracks closer to shore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 1–3 ft surge along the southeast Florida barrier islands, higher if the eye comes ashore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches possible with isolated amounts up to 10 inches, leading to flash flooding concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor coastal flooding could hamper port operations.
